ovdesc.p: This table is used to define the parameter records for Regulation CC, Regulation E, Regulation DD, Regulation E ,BNotices and Customer Escheat

desc.p: Should be a valid US Regulations
desc.P: There should be a record in EB.LOOKUP for Valid US regulations.

desc.p: This is to describe the purpose of the condition
Should be a valid record id from the HOLIDAY application determining which calendar logic should be referred to determine the working /business days for hold condition.
Optional input, Drop down values from the HOLIDAY table.

This field helps to indicate the Expiry Date for the hold condition of an Account. Any hold placed for that Account after this expiry date will be considered as the new condition or it will default SYSTEM/ Customer hold condition.
Number of days till which the account is considered as a new account.
This would determine number of time repeated overdraft occurred for an account as parameterized in the field OD.TIME.PERIOD.
This field specifies the number of days after which an account has to be considered as overdrawn (OD) account.
This field indicates the amount that will be available for immediate withdrawal for the customer.
Up to 14 characters plus a decimal point (Standard Amount Format) - type AMT. (Optional input)
This field helps to choose the method of withdrawal for the Customer.
If the value is selected as IMMEDIATE, then the amount given in the field AVAIL.AMOUNT will be immediately available to the Customer.
If the value is selected as NEXTDAY, then the amount given in the field AVAIL.AMOUNT will be available next day to the Customer.
Radio Button: Immediate, Next Day and Default Value - None.
This field would determine the type of check deposit. For any new type of check, create a record in EB.LOOKUP application.
Multi value set, drop down with values Local, Non-Local, Next Day, On-Us and Government.
The currency for which the hold condition is being created for an account.
Valid record in the CURRENCY table.
Shows the threshold amount to be considered as Small deposit, for which HOLD.DAYS1 condition would be applied.
1-14 characters plus a decimal point (Standard Amount Format) type AMOUNT. (Optional input)
This field indicates the number of days for hold condition for (small deposit) check amount which is lesser than AMT.LESS.OR.EQ value.
1-2 Numeric Characters, Optional Input, No default values.
This field indicates the threshold amount to be considered as large deposit, for which HOLD.DAYS2 condition would be applied.
Up to 14 characters plus a decimal point (Standard Amount Format) - type AMOUNT. (Optional input)
This field indicates the number of days for hold condition for (large deposit) check amount which is greater than AMT.GREATER values.
1-2 Numeric Characters, Optional Input, No default values.
This field is used to indicate the number of days within which the form W9 has to be submitted for TIN/SSN certification.
This field denotes the allowed number of days for a foreign customer to be exempted from withholding the tax.
This field is used to indicate number of days within which the customer has to submit the revised TIN/SSN information received from the IRS department.
The END.DATE will be defaulted in CUST.DOCUMENT application based on this field.
This field will have valid transaction codes used for regulations which is part of id.
Valid record in the TRANSACTION table.
This field would determine the type of check deposit. For any new type of check, create a record in EB.LOOKUP application.
Multi value set, drop down with values Local, Non-Local, Next Day, On-Us and Government.
This field will have valid category codes used for the regulations which is part of id.
Valid record in the CATEGORY table.
This field is used to input the Sectors types of the customer to whom the notification letter should be generated.
validation Rule : 1-4 numeric character Sector code.It can be 'ALL' or a valid code on the SECTOR table.Multi-value field
This field is used to input the sector types of the customer to whom the notification letter should be excluded
validation Rule : 1-4 numeric character Sector code.It can be 'ALL' or a valid code on the SECTOR table.Multi-value field
This field is used to define the valid AA products that should be excluded from Customer Escheat
validation Rule : Alphanumeric 1-20 character Valid ID from AA.PRODUCT
This field is used to define the valid Posting Restrict that should be used for Escheat Customer
validation Rule : 1 to 4 numeric characters Posting Restriction code, based on EB.OBJECT Valid ID from POSTING.RESTRICT

des.p: The field is used to specify the number of days in advance for generation of pre notice.
Manual Input. Mandatory for Regulation E record.

desc.p: Define the No of Inactive months to set Customer to Escheat status
To flag a customer whether to opt in for the Privacy status or not
It can be either Opt-In or Opt-Out
